title: Front Wrap Cross Carry
text:
abbreviation
FWCC


type
front carry


pass types used
Torso Pass, Cross Pass


size
Base Size


finish variations



number of shoulders
2


level
beginner


type of wrap
Woven Wrap, Stretchy Wrap, Hybrid Wrap


characteristics
Poppable with a Stretchy


good for
Straighteners, Nursing, Sleep Transfer, Newborns, Toddlers and Support

title: Front Wrap Cross Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Base Size – Torso Pass + 2 Cross Passes
Torso Pass (Optional: Fold wrap hot dog style with rails up)
Cross in Back and bring tails over shoulders
Slide baby in pocket
Two Cross Passes, spread or bunched
Tie in Back

title: Pocket Wrap Cross Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Pocket Wrap Cross Carry – Base Size – 2 Cross Passes + Torso Pass Torso Pass around belly and cross wrap in back over shoulders Bring each tail through the Torso Pass Place baby in pocket Cross tails, spread, tighten, and Tie in Back

title: Base Size Carries
text: Base Size is defined as the woven wrap size needed to do Front Wrap Cross Carry. Base Size can be affected by the size of the wearee, wrap thickness, and taper depth. The Base Size Guide provides some guidance for finding one’s Base Size, but the only way to know for sure is to start wrapping!

title: Base Size Guide
text:
Base Size is the defined as the woven wrap size needed to do Front Wrap Cross Carry. Base Size can be affected by the size and shape of the wearer, size of the wearee, wrap thickness, taper depth, tightening ability/preference, how much clothing is being worn by the wearer and wearee, and wrapping qualities of the woven wrap.
For new wearers looking for a starting point, T-shirt size may be used as a rough guide for finding your base size. However, it’s quite common to find your true base is a size above or a size below what is suggested here as there are other factors at play beyond clothing size. The best way to find your actual Base Size is to try Front Wrap Cross Carry in the wrap size recommended by this T-shirt size guide, as well as a size (or more) up and a size (or more) down. A wrapper’s Base Size will likely change over time.



Base Wrap Size 4
some XS


Base Wrap Size 5
XS - S, some M


Base Wrap Size 6
M - L, some S and XL


Base Wrap Size 7
XL - 2XL, some L and 2XL+


Base Wrap Size 8
2XL+, some XL


Base Wrap Size 9+
some 2XL+



Keep in mind that factors such as wrapping a larger child, using a thicker wrap, or a preference for longer tails may require a size up.

title: Front Torso Cross Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Front Torso Cross Carry – Base Size – Torso Pass + Two Reinforcing Passes Torso Pass (Optional: Fold wrap hot dog style with rails up) Cross in Back and bring tails over shoulders Slide baby in pocket and tighten Slide tails down to go under arms instead of over shoulders Two bunched Reinforcing Passes Tie in back

title: Reinforced Robin’s Hip Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Reinforced Robin’s Hip Carry – Base Size – 2 Traditional Sling Passes + Cross Pass Fold wrap in half lengthwise and place middle in corsage position Drape tails around back diagonally and thread through loop Slide baby in both Traditional Sling Passes and tighten Split wrap and take closest tail over baby and under leg for Cross Pass Other tail comes down around waist and tie in back

title: About
text:
We built the orignal version of this woven wrap carries wiki in 2014 to make it easier to search for carries by wrap size or other attributes (like, “good for leaners”), featuring carry recipes, carry diagrams, and links to tutorials from the global babywearing community.
After being offline for a few years, we’re working to rebuild the site. Since a lot of our original tutorial links are broken or point to inaccessible, we’re starting fresh, and could use your help to identify the best tutorials around today! Please be patient as we work to get back to being fully functional. If you’d like to recommend a tutorial (or a new carry!) please reach out to us through Facebook or pull request.

title: Woven Wrap Sizes
text:
Woven Wraps are generally sold in sizes 1-10.



Size 1
2.2m


Size 2
2.6m


Size 3
3.2m


Size 4
3.6m


Size 5
4.2m


Size 6
4.6m


Size 7
5.2m


Size 8
5.6m


Size 9
6.2m


Size 10
6.6m

text:
abbreviation
FDH


type
front carry


pass types used
Traditional Sling Pass


size
Base Size


finish variations
TUB, Knotless


number of shoulders
2


level



type of wrap
Woven Wrap


characteristics



good for
Leaners

title: Front Double Hammock
text:
Carry Recipe
Front Double Hammock – Base Size – 2 Traditional Sling Passes Spread wrap across back and bring under arms Two Traditional Sling Passes in front Flip shoulders by bringing outside rail to the inside Cross in Back Can bring tails over traditional sling passes at hips, under and up for knotless Place baby in both traditional sling passes (Can TUB if not doing knotless)

type
front carry


pass types used
Cross Pass


size
Base Size


finish variations
TIF or Knotless


number of shoulders
2


level



type of wrap
Woven Wrap


characteristics
Poppable, optional Shoulder Flip


good for
Straighteners, Nursing, Sleep Transfer, Toddlers and Support

title: Front Cross Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Front Cross Carry – Base Size – 2 Cross Passes Bunch wrap across back and bring under arms 2 Cross Passes in front Cross in back Can TIF or go over cross passes at hips, under and up for knotless Slide baby into the cross passes Tighten and readjust, spread passes, shoulder flip optional

title: Front Wrap Cross Carry
text:
abbreviation
FWCC


type
front carry


pass types used
Torso Pass, Cross Pass


size
Base Size


finish variations



number of shoulders
2


level
beginner


type of wrap
Woven Wrap, Stretchy Wrap, Hybrid Wrap


characteristics
Poppable with a Stretchy


good for
Straighteners, Nursing, Sleep Transfer, Newborns, Toddlers and Support

title: Front Wrap Cross Carry
text:
Carry Recipe
Base Size – Torso Pass + 2 Cross Passes
Torso Pass (Optional: Fold wrap hot dog style with rails up)
Cross in Back and bring tails over shoulders
Slide baby in pocket
Two Cross Passes, spread or bunched
Tie in Back
